reed@ -- Can you take a look, or find someone who can?  Thanks.

mbarbella@ -- What's the best approach when clusterfuzz says "AddressSanitizer can not provide additional info?"  The report seems vague.

cc'ing those with related CLs.

It means that the access didn't land at an address that ASan is tracking (and the report is from ASan itself). Probably an OOB access that's so far off that it didn't land in a redzone.

You can try running with larger redzones (ASAN_OPTIONS=redzone=XXXX), but in general there's not a good way to squeeze extra information out of ASan in the case of a wild read or write.

[Slimming Paint] Build transform trees from display item lists.

This is the beginning of building transform trees from display item lists.

This CL only handles 3D transforms (as arise from CSS transforms), and in
particular it does not yet handle:
- merging
- identity of transforms (to associate the same transform source when it
  reoccurs)
- fixed position, scrolling, and other features which will require nodes
- calling of this code at an appropriate time during painting
- association of this information with the display item list exposed to the
  compositor
- building of actual compositor layers from this information

These are intentionally left until later to limit the size of individual CLs.

BUG=460986

[Slimming Paint] Send full 3D transforms to cc.

Currently, we're extracting the affine transform from a 4x4 matrix, and
then converting it back to an SkMatrix44.

Instead, let's just send the 4x4 matrix we have to convey all the
information. If in the future we do want to separate 2D and 3D transforms
in the interface, we would do that by adding a method that passes an
SkMatrix over the boundary for 2D transforms, rather than SkMatrix44.

BUG=460986

3D transforms can occur for multiple reasons, and so we need multiple types
per client. For instance, an element may have a transform, and also apply
a perspective transform to some of its children.

I intend to use this to do computations that separate out the transform origin
from the transformation matrix, and this is a useful utility function
which makes it less error-prone (in particular, I always forget which offset
should have translate and which should have translateRight).

Author: jbroman@chromium.org <jbroman@chromium.org>
Date: Thu Sep 17 22:03:42 2015

Implement and test TransformationMatrix::applyTransformOrigin.

I intend to use this to do computations that separate out the transform origin
from the transformation matrix, and this is a useful utility function
which makes it less error-prone (in particular, I always forget which offset
should have translate and which should have translateRight).

Author: dongseong.hwang <dongseong.hwang@intel.com>
Date: Thu Aug 20 09:09:23 2015

gpu: If not cube complete, the texture isn't renderable, no matter mipmap complete.

GLES2 spec 3.8.2 says
"A cube map sampler is called, and either the corresponding cube map texture
image is not cube complete, or TEXTURE_MIN_FILTER is one that requires
a mipmap and the texture is not mipmap cube complete."

However, Texture::GetCanRenderCondition() checks cube complete only if the texture
needs mipmap.

TEST=gpu_unittests TextureTest.POTCubeMapWithoutMipmap
BUG=517548

Chrome Version: 46.0.2466.3 (Official Build) Revision a40405dbf43e041e36b956f8b5918b4db3f75416-refs/branch-heads/2466@{#3} 32/64 bit OS: Windows (Win 7: Aero enabled) What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Launch Chrome in Kiosk mode (with --kiosk) and open dev tools window by pressing F12. 2. Now click on chevron/overflow button in the header menu of inspect element window, observe. Options listed under that overflow icon do not open i.e. click event is not triggered after clicking on chevron icon in dev tools window. Chevron button should be click able and options list should get opened. This is a regression issue broken in M-45 and will soon update bisect info. Note: To enable Kiosk mode: 1. Right click on your Desktop and go to New > Shortcut 2. Browse to the chrome.exe file (depending on your set up, it might be found here: users//AppData/Local/Google/Chrome/Application/chrome.exe) and click Next 3. Type a name for the shortcut (e.g. “Chrome Kiosk Mode”) and click Finish. 4. Right click on that new shortcut on your Desktop and go to Properties. 5. At the end of your Target, append with “--kiosk http://google.com” and click OK. 6. Double-click the shortcut on your Desktop to launch Chrome in Kiosk mode with google.com site opened.

Below is the narrow bisect for above issue:
https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+log/f55d90e253a069a6de25ac3be57119ca77491bf6..504e93628a525b6e32dfa0609c23e4fd5bc195cf?pretty=fuller&n=50

Suspecting: r337741 ? from above narrow bisect

Note: Issue not seen on Mac and Linux OS.
Adding release block label, please undo if not the case.

(I don't really think Dev Tools should be accessible in kiosk mode to begin with.)

This is not release-block, kiosk mode is an unsupported feature.

frederic.jacob.78, can you look into this?

I am already on it! I updated my Windows machine and build the code while I was at work. I ran a little debug session at my return and as I suspected the button trigger a context menu when click and so execute the RenderViewContextMenuViews::Show() function that I modified to remove context menu in kiosk mode for the webview area.

(I also think that the Dev tools should not be accessible in kiosk mode!)
Hmm.  Maybe it would be easier, then, to disconnect Dev Tools in kiosk mode than to try and fix this.

You are right disconnecting the Dev tools should be easier. 
I don't think that detecting which mouse click or on where the user clicked is possible in RenderViewContextMenuViews::Show(). So the only way to fix this is to change the Dev tools to not use the context menu. 

Disconnecting the Dev tool look to be possible in browser_commands.cpp for all OS. So if you are comfortable with disconnecting the Dev tools in kiosk mode, I can analyze it more and do a CL.
Yeah, let's just disable the dev tools.

(See http://www.chromium.org/blink#launch-process for an overview) Change description: The new CSSOM provides typed style access for developers. This will generally improve performance primarily by removing the need to do lots of string parsing. In addition to this, it will enable performant development of various new Houdini specifications (including custom properties, layout and paint). Changes to API surface: - New API Links: Public standards discussion: https://lists.w3.org/Archives/Public/public-houdini/2015Oct/0011.html Support in other browsers: Internet Explorer: not implemented Firefox: not implemented Safari: not implemented Security and privacy reviews are not yet required as this is still in an experimental stage.

CssTypedOM: Implement TransformComponent and ScaleTransformComponent

This implements the TransformComponent interface, as according to the
spec below.

An enum TransformComponentType is used to classify each of the
classes / constructors, corresponding to the OperationType enum in
third_party/WebKit/Source/platform/transforms/TransformOperation.h

The ScaleTransformComponent scaffold is also implemented as a dummy
class for testing and is not fully implemented.
In particular, 'm_is2D' might change in a later implementation.

 - a, b, ... , f attributes (needed for 2D matrix) are just aliases

Update StyleValue.cssString() to use existing methods instead of rolling our own.

All StyleValues now use toCSSValue()->cssText() instead of defining
custom methods in subclasses.

Conveniently, this effectively allows toCSSValue to be tested in
LayoutTests. Also get rid of re-parsing unit types in
SimpleLength.toCSSValue, since the code there had a bug anyway
which was uncovered by the LayoutTests.

commit 2a40cf093c3a596c0658e12cd24a32086817f057
Author: tridgell <tridgell@google.com>
Date: Wed Feb 10 23:14:45 2016

Typed CSS OM: implement TransformComponent::asMatrix

All methods used for generating the underlying matrix in asMatrix
are in MatrixTransformComponent.cpp

Constructs each MatrixTransformComponent for use in
asMatrix methods manually, rather than using inbuilt
methods to avoid unnecessary matrix multiplication.
(With the exception of rotate and rotate3d, as they require
far more complex calculations.)

Note: asMatrix for a MatrixTransformComponent returns a clone.

Date: Thu Apr 14 07:40:12 2016

Implement StyleValue.parse for CSS Typed OM

Spec: https://drafts.css-houdini.org/css-typed-om/#stylevalue-objects

For now it only supports parsing values that result in
SimpleLength objects - this is dependent on implementing other
types in the StyleValueFactory.

Note: parse returns an object? instead of a
(StyleValue or sequence<StyleValue>)?, because the code generator
generates "#error not implemented yet" in the latter case.

commit 5a2a7ffb7245ca5d7491aafd2388ff94aeb95d47
Author: meade <meade@chromium.org>
Date: Wed Jun 08 08:40:22 2016

Move CSSValue->CSSStyleValue logic out of StylePropertyMap and into the StyleValueFactory.

Also rename StylePropertyMap::StyleValueVector to just
CSSStyleValueVector.

This is in preparation for adding logic to build more types of
CSSStyleValues and TransformComponents out of CSSValues. It doesn't
make sense for the StylePropertyMap to contain all the logic around
different properties.

commit 09bfd57f7db4f626a19d29e3ee9ca6d1ae3eb1dd
Author: meade <meade@chromium.org>
Date: Thu Dec 01 06:58:15 2016

Add a property test generator for testing the inline StylePropertyMap

This will allow easier testing of each property as we add support in
CSS Typed OM, as we will not have to hand-write exhaustive tests for each
property, and we will easily be able to add a new test that applies to
every element easily if we need to later.

The standard set of tests is:

*single-valued properties*
- Setting with a sequence of valid values throws
- Calling append with a valid value throws

*list-valued properties*
- Setting with a sequence of valid values works
- Setting with a sequence containing valid and invalid values throws
- Append succeeds with a valid value
- Appending a sequence of valid values succeeds
- Append throws when given an invalid value
- Append throws when given a sequence containing valid and invalid values
- GetAll when the property is set to a list returns all the properties

*common*
- Can be set to each valid keyword (automatically adds initial, inherit
    and unset)
- Can be set to each given valid instance of StyleValue
- Setting to an invalid type throws (automatically adds null, undefined,
    true, false, 1, 'hello', {}, and a fake keyword)
- Get returns the right KeywordValue when the property is set to each
    valid keyword
- Get returns the right StyleValue when the property is set to .cssText
    of each given valid StyleValue
- GetAll works when the property is set to a valid StyleValue instance
- Delete removes the style from the element
- GetProperties includes the name of the property when it is set
    to something

I've added example tests for "bottom" and "animation-direction", as
semi-random, convenient single-valued and list-valued properties.

Note that since getting CSSKeyword from a StylePropertyMap is not yet fully
supported, the new tests fail.

commit 0eebfb8ffb2b8730c2679d41c011f2871b28cdf1
Author: meade <meade@chromium.org>
Date: Mon Dec 19 04:05:14 2016

Remove double constructors that assume degrees from CSSRotation

Instead, use only constructors that take CSSAngleValues, so that the
unit is explicit, then actually store this information.

This is to reflect the spec change that removed these constructors in
https://github.com/w3c/css-houdini-drafts/commit/535591271f88d71fd7ca60dc4132db15f93b980a

Also includes:
- Adding support for making a CSSAngleValue out of a
    CSSPrimitiveValue, to continue supporting getting
    CSSTransform(CSSRotation) from inline StylePropertyMaps.
- Moves some of the inlineStyle CSSRotation tests to use the
    property-suite for more thorough testing. I was not able
    to convert all the tests, as I still have to figure out
    how to test the behaviour when the value is set using the
    old CSSOM to something like "rotateX", "rotateY" and
    "rotateZ".

commit 857445ffbc21f9cac8a018128a3a92574fe3d784
Author: meade <meade@chromium.org>
Date: Thu Jan 12 02:58:47 2017

Implement support for CSSValue -> CSSCalcLength

The CSSValue must be a CSSPrimitiveValue containing a CSSCalcValue.

For example:
testElement.style.width = "calc(4 * (5em - 2px))";
testElmenet.styleMap.get('width');
// Returns CSSCalcLength({px: -8, em: 20})

Also removes redundant test typedcssom/inlinestyle/left-top-right-bottom.html
(superceded by typedcssom/inlinestyle/properties/bottom.html; will
add the others later)

commit c85bc01513148e381d656d88a7f8a773704d6c34
Author: raphael.kubo.da.costa <raphael.kubo.da.costa@intel.com>
Date: Sat Feb 11 13:37:00 2017

bindings: Make some value iterator properties aliases to Array.prototype functions

The WebIDL spec states that value iterators in an interface should cause the
following operations to be added and be originally set to the corresponding
property of ECMAScript's %ArrayPrototype%:
* entries
* forEach
* keys
* values

Stop generating custom methods for those operations in the bindings when a
value iterator is defined; instead, just set properties with those names to
the corresponding intrinsics values from V8.

This allows us to get a lot of code for free, avoid duplicating iterator
code in Blink and remove the ValueIterable class altogether from the
bindings code.

However, doing so does require us to adjust non-conforming IDLs:
https://heycam.github.io/webidl/#idl-iterable states that "a value iterator
must only be declared on an interface that supports indexed properties", and
"supports indexed properties" means an interface has an indexed getter
operation as well as an integer-type attribute called "length". Some IDLs in
Blink only had an "iterable<V>" declaration without the accompanying getter
and "length" attribute. In the case of both CSSTransformValue and
CSSUnparsedValue, a spec bug was also filed upstream to tackle this at the
source.

Finally, the bindings generation code now raises a ValueError if an
interface only has an iterable<V> declaration without the accompanying
indexed property getter and length attribute.

commit 83749ddd60c44dfc2c418545ae47e62b686e0cd9
Author: meade <meade@chromium.org>
Date: Fri Mar 10 08:55:28 2017

[CSS Typed OM] Rearrange StylePropertyMap classes to match the new spec.

The edited spec is here:
https://drafts.css-houdini.org/css-typed-om/#the-stylepropertymap

Broadly, the changes are:

- Rename ImmutableStylePropertyMap -> StylePropertyMapReadonly
- Switch StylePropertyMap to inherit from StylePropertyMapReadonly
instead of the other way around
- Update all references appropriately

commit 87daf831df32fc0dbcef5672c72b678574ee62a2
Author: meade <meade@chromium.org>
Date: Thu May 11 09:06:42 2017

Use assert_equals(result.constructor.name, StyleValueType.name) for clearer error messages

This gives more helpful error messages, like
"Expected StyleValueType, but got <something else>", instead of
"Expected true, but got false".

This CL was generated using the grep/sed command
grep -rl "assert_true(.* instanceof"  typedcssom/ | xargs sed -i -e 's/assert_true(\(.*\) instanceof \(.*\)\(,.*\))/assert_equals(\1.constructor.name, \2.name\3)/'

commit 42110b22278552b70e9b5156148df454e77f6be5
Author: meade <meade@chromium.org>
Date: Fri May 26 05:37:26 2017

Delete obsolete number and length classes from Typed OM

This breaks most of our layout tests, since most things
depend on numbers and lengths, but it's better to be in
a single half state than have two half states hanging
around.

BUG=545318

The following revision refers to this bug:
  https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/2656da0429614ad0134c22e9695a619907d11a78

commit 2656da0429614ad0134c22e9695a619907d11a78
Author: meade <meade@chromium.org>
Date: Fri May 26 08:13:48 2017

Make CSSKeywordValue's value attribute mutable

Also update the attribute name to "value" to match the spec, and
change the type to a plain String, to avoid interning random
developer strings inside AtomicString when we don't need to.

In the original spec for Typed OM, every StyleValue subclass was
immutable, so you'd need to create new ones if you wanted to udpate
something. It turns out that this can be expensive due to garbage
collection churn, and it's now been changed so that StyleValue
subclasses are mutable.

CSSKeywordValue spec (note no "readonly" keyword on value now)
https://drafts.css-houdini.org/css-typed-om/#csskeywordvalue

BUG=545318

commit b24e869c0085f7cb80020f073f731c43ae97eb17
Author: hs1217.lee <hs1217.lee@samsung.com>
Date: Sat Jun 03 00:23:10 2017

[css-typed-om] add toMatrix() method in CSSTransformValue.idl

The toMatrix() method of a CSSTransformValue this must,
when called, perform the following steps:
1.Let matrix be a 4x4 matrix, initially set to the identity matrix.
2.For each func in this’s values to iterate over,
 set matrix to the result of multiplying matrix
 and func’s equivalent 4x4 transform matrix.
3.Return a new DOMMatrix representing matrix.

https://drafts.css-houdini.org/css-typed-om-1/#dom-csstransformvalue-tomatrix

commit ee27a36a85422f591853031122a77a5d01ecc68d
Author: meade <meade@chromium.org>
Date: Mon Jun 05 03:03:53 2017

Restructure type tracking in StyleValues to work better with new numeric types.

The enum CSSStyleValue::StyleValueType is now used to track the
"strong type"
(https://drafts.css-houdini.org/css-typed-om/#cssnumericvalue-strong-type)
of each style value.

Reviewers, please add thoughts on putting "ContainsPercent" on
CSSStyleValue. I couldn't think of a good way to express
"CSSStyleValues can be <a non-percent type> *and* a percent at
the same time (e.g. calc(3px + 2%)). However this is only used
on CSSNumericValue subclasses.

Additional notes:
- User border-*-width for testing setting CSSUnitValues as lengths.
- border-*-width was previously marked as supports_percent, but it
actually does not
(https://developer.mozilla.org/en/docs/Web/CSS/border-bottom-width)
- There is now a list of valid values for typedom_types in
CSSProperties.json5
- supports_percentage is now implied by including "Percent" in
typedom_types

affect ToCSSValue and AsMatrix (used by CSSTransformValue)
(https://github.com/w3c/css-houdini-drafts/issues/414)

- CSSMatrixComponent takes an options dictionary to specify its 2D-ness.

UserAgent: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; CrOS x86_64 7390.48.0) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/46.0.2490.52 Safari/537.36

Steps to reproduce the problem:
I think http://homakov.blogspot.com/2014/01/using-content-security-policy-for-evil.html wasn't fixed correctly, please take a look.

This PoC (with Service Workers):
  https://sirdarckcat.github.io/csp/

?q=bar and ?q=baz should work. Because they create a redirect, which means that only the origin part of the CSP should apply, however, as you can see, the full policy is applied.

This means that by using Service Workers, you can check whether the full path applies or not. In other words, all the attacks from Homakov from last year should work today with a simple Service Worker that does onfetch=f(e){e.respondWith(fetch(e.request));}

Here's a better example, using a similar PoC from 2014:
  (with SW) https://sirdarckcat.github.io/csp/homakov.html
  (without SW) http://sirdarckcat.github.io/csp/homakov.html
As you see, the SW example triggers violation reports for places where the user is logged in, but none for when the user isn't logged in.

What is the expected behavior?
Service Workers should check:
  1. response.url == request.url
  2. if the same, then let the default CSP apply
  3. if different, then only validate the origins

Note that this still differs from the spec in that intermediate redirects won't be checked by CSP, but whatever.

What went wrong?
Maybe we should give up with CSP ;P

Did this work before? N/A 

Chrome version: 46.0.2490.52  Channel: n/a
OS Version: 7390.48.0
Flash Version: Shockwave Flash 19.0 r0
Why is this OS-Chrome and not OS-All? Nothing CrOS specific about this.
I think the wizard added it because I filed the bug with my Chromebook.
Adding some service worker folks.

evn@: Does this behavior only crop up if a SW is present?

+estark@ for the redirect behavior.
Ah, yes. I see the 2014 demo now. This does look like bad interaction with whatever SW is doing to reroute requests.
horo-san, would you be able to take a look?
Hello again horo@!

evn@
We meet again!! :)

I didn't know such kind of attacks.

We should probably remove this "if" section in ResourceFetcher::didReceiveResponse().
https://code.google.com/p/chromium/codesearch#chromium/src/third_party/WebKit/Source/core/fetch/ResourceFetcher.cpp&l=927

Ah, interesting! Thanks for the pointer horo@.

So Mike, what is it? :-)

The spec probably doesn't say what to do, but with Service Worker runtime Caches the behavior is ambiguous, I think.

You probably still want to check the response URL matches the CSP, I think it should be with the origin-based check, but this needs to be added to the spec.
Mike?

For reference this is Homakov's old bug

https://code.google.com/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=313737

1. The CSP integration with Fetch is more or less fixed as of https://github.com/whatwg/fetch/commit/8ce550b53c53e2b6e8376373b94d66b2eeada8f8. I'll have to look at https://w3c.github.io/webappsec-csp/#should-block-response to make sure it handles this case correctly, but I think it will.

2. We shouldn't remove the `if` in `didReceiveResponse`. We should fix the redirect check at https://code.google.com/p/chromium/codesearch#chromium/src/third_party/WebKit/Source/core/loader/FrameFetchContext.cpp&rcl=1445311561&l=424 to use the lax behavior if the response came through a service worker (that is, `response.followedRedirect() || response.wasFetchedViaServiceWorker()`). horo@ would you like to take a stab at that fix, or shall I?
Wouldn't that change disable path matching for all pages that use CSP?

Duh, sorry.. I meant..

Wouldn't that disable path matching for all pages that use Service Workers.
On Oct 20, 2015 10:57, wrote:

It would disable path matching on the response if the response went through the service worker. This seems safe, because the page shouldn't be able to distinguish between the case where the network generates a redirect, and the case where the service worker responds with something different to what the page expected. The SW _is_ the network, so far as the page is concerned.

Am I missing an attack vector here? This seems like a reasonable thing to do...

I mean, you probably want to only apply the "weak matching" algorithm if
request.url != response.url, otherwise every request will go through SWs,
and as a result no request will be matched for paths.

The only time we check paths is the initial request (because otherwise we're the result of a redirect). We perform that check before we hit the service worker.

This check is verifying the _response_, which means that we can assume that we've already been through the 'request' check. It also means that it's not quite as simple a patch as I thought, as we'll have to teach `canRequest*` about service workers, but whatever. That should be simple, and doesn't change the central point. :)
I see, SGTM! :)

I created a cl for this issue.
https://codereview.chromium.org/1454003003/

The following revision refers to this bug:
  https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/114b8b13ab4fd5c83eb42986946b0051fdd10127

commit 114b8b13ab4fd5c83eb42986946b0051fdd10127
Author: horo <horo@chromium.org>
Date: Fri Nov 20 03:14:57 2015

[CSP] Don't check the path component of the URL when the response was fetched via ServiceWorker.

In ResourceFetcher::didReceiveResponse() we check the response URL when the response is fetched via ServiceWorker.
But the match algorithm should ignore the path component of the URL.

summary: Task Manager uses old Task Manager backend (Mac)
title: Task Manager uses old Task Manager backend (Mac)

comments.content:
Version: M47
OS: 10.10

The Task Manager UI on the Mac still uses the old implementation of the Task Manager window backend. This is a tracking bug for deciding whether or not to switch to the new, more-efficient backend.

shrike@ As agreed, I landed a CL that exposes the task manager view reusable code. You can now go ahead and migrate the Mac's view to use the new task manager implementation.

All you need to do is to:
- Implement the TableViewDelegate interface.
- Use the task_management::kColumns[] to build your table columns (as in NewTaskManagerView::Init()).
- Create task_management::TaskManagerTableModel providing it with the concrete TableViewDelegate.
- Call TaskManagerTableModel::Start/StopUpdating() as appropriate.
- Use the TaskManagerTableModel APIs to store the columns visibility and sort order, retrieve them, and toggle the columns visibility.
- Your new task manager view implementation should be enabled by default for all users (to match the behavior of chrome on all other platforms) unless the --disable-new-task-manager flag is set. See https://code.google.com/p/chromium/codesearch#chromium/src/chrome/browser/ui/views/task_manager_view.cc&q=chrome::ShowTask&sq=package:chromium&l=649-664

- Please use the code in new_task_manager_view.cc/h https://code.google.com/p/chromium/codesearch#chromium/src/chrome/browser/ui/views/new_task_manager_view.cc&q=f:%20new_task_manager_view&sq=package:chromium&l=1 for reference. Let me know if you need help with anything. Thanks!
What is the status of this issue?

I think Sarah is exploring a possible option of simply running the toolkit-views taskmanager UI on Mac (Issue 564908)

Depending on timelines and other things, this may be an alternative to porting the Cocoa UI over. But views UI on Mac will be behind a default-disabled chrome://flag on mac at least until M51.

The Cocoa task manager XIB + controller is not huge. It's actually kinda neat. That's not always a signal that things are easy to change - I haven't looked enough into what's involved for this to say something more useful.

> What is the status of this issue?

On my end I'm currently in the middle of Material Design work and some other smaller projects, so really no cycles to devote to this work right now. As tapted said, Views might be the solution, and it sounds like this could happen sooner rather than later.
tapted@ Can we just use the Views task manager UI on mac at this stage? If so, no migration is required.

I was reviewing a CL and found that we have two Views implementations of task manager:
  chrome/browser/ui/views/new_task_manager_view.cc
  chrome/browser/ui/views/task_manager_view.cc
Can we remove the old Views task manager impl? Is that somehow blocked on Mac [Views]?

(Some browser tests also reportedly rely on the old impl, but we should be able to disable tests using the old ui/backend on Views, so long as there are tests for the new ui/backend on Views, and the old tests can still run under Cocoa)

I just took a look at the Views Task Manager - wow, it needs a lot of work before we can ship it on the Mac. In general going with the Views task manager instead of retrofitting the current Mac one makes a lot of sense, but given the current state of the Views Task Manager I'm not sure what we're going to do down the road.
Re #9: Your recommendation makes sense. I'm going to file a bug to remove task_manager_view.cc as well as the flag, and run only the browser tests for the old backend on Mac for now.

This is probably redundant :), but

re #c8: at this stage, no, we're not ready to ship the views task manager UI on Mac. We may be looking to do that in Q3 2016 at the earliest but, like shrike@ says, there are a lot of polish issues to fix before we can replace the Cocoa task manager.

And with spqchan@'s change r386897 we're skipping straight to the "new" views task manager UI, and ignoring the old one. So, yes, it should be safe to remove  task_manager_view.cc.

We're moving the old UI to the new backend.

603440 is about a visual problem with the new UI so that does not block.
Issue 631502 has been merged into this issue.

summary: CrSettingsBrowserTest failing on memory fyi bots
title: CrSettingsBrowserTest failing on memory fyi bots

comments.content:
CrElementsBrowserTest has apparently been failing on MSan tests:

http://chromium-build-logs.appspot.com/gtest_query?gtest_query=CrElementsBrowserTest.CrElementsTest

That test was recently ported to CrSettingsBrowserTest, which is now failing too:

http://chromium-build-logs.appspot.com/gtest_query?gtest_query=CrSettingsBrowserTest.CrSettingsTest

CL to disable the test: https://codereview.chromium.org/1359763002/

To investigate:
* why the test times out on memory bots -- it goes from 300ms on my machine to >2000ms, which is the default mocha timeout
* why I wasn't notified until I submitted an unrelated patch
* how often these failures happen -- have the memory.fyi bots been red for days??

The following revision refers to this bug:
  https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/bac4bd4c474df6058e218bd1dec878da3da440c4

commit bac4bd4c474df6058e218bd1dec878da3da440c4
Author: michaelpg <michaelpg@chromium.org>
Date: Tue Sep 22 07:57:46 2015

Disable CrSettingsBrowserTest.CrSettingsTest

BUG=534718
TBR=dbeam@chromium.org

Review URL: https://codereview.chromium.org/1359763002

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/master@{#350127}

[modify] http://crrev.com/bac4bd4c474df6058e218bd1dec878da3da440c4/chrome/test/data/webui/settings/cr_settings_browsertest.js

I'm pretty sure this was a result of https://codereview.chromium.org/1344303004/

It looks like it was the change you suggested to elim. done():

From http://build.chromium.org/p/chromium.memory.fyi/builders/Linux%20MSan%20Tests/builds/9842/steps/browser_tests/logs/CrSettingsBrowserTest.CrSettingsTest

[27117:27117:0921/224619:INFO:CONSOLE(1324)] "Running TestCase CrSettingsBrowserTest.CrSettingsTest", source: test_api.js (1324)
[27117:27117:0921/224621:ERROR:CONSOLE(39)] "Mocha test failed: CrSettingsCheckbox "before all" hook
Error: timeout of 2000ms exceeded. Ensure the done() callback is being called in this test.
", source: mocha_adapter.js (39)

I am going to try restoring that and re-enabling the test.
Oh, I missed the part where it had been failing on CrElementsBrowserTest, so nevermind... I've got no idea. I can try to help investigate later today.

summary: UI glitch while playing MP4 video from drive in Media Player
title: UI glitch while playing MP4 video from drive in Media Player

comments.content: Chrome Version: 44.0.2403.156 Chrome OS Version: 7077.134.0 Chrome OS Platform: Lumpy_freon, parrot_freon Network info: WiFi Please specify Cr-* of the system to which this bug/feature applies (add the label below). Steps To Reproduce: 1. Open drive from file manager 2. play any MP4 video from drive in media player 3. Expected Result: No UI glitch Actual Result: Observing UI glitch as shown in screenshot below entire video playback How frequently does this problem reproduce? (Always, sometimes, hard to reproduce?) Always What is the impact to the user, and is there a workaround? If so, what is it? Please provide any additional information below. Attach a screen shot or log if possible. Screenshot added below
Screenshot : https://pantheon.corp.google.com/m/cloudstorage/b/chromiumos-test-logs/o/bugfiles/cr/521826/1.png

This is also reproduced on 46.0.2472.0/7330.0.0 and 45.0.2454.37/7262.33.0.
this is not reproduced on Non freon parrot device on 44.0.2403.156/7077.134.0.
This was regressed in M44. I'm removing the blocker label for M45.
This is an SNB Freon regression. SNB Freon going 100% in M45.
thanks hshi!

I will take a look, but let's not jump to conclusions here. Just based on comment #2 by avkodipelli, we cannot conclude that this is a Freon regression, unless you can show side-by-side that the problem happens on lumpy-freon but not on non-freon at the same release.

Note that the issue only happens when playing the MP4 video file on Google Drive from the Files app.

It DOES NOT repro when

(1) the same file on Drive is played from the web (drive.google.com)
(2) the same file is downloaded and played from the Files app locally
(3) the same file is downloaded and played from the browser using the file:///home/chronos/user/Downloads URL

The corruption posted in comment #1 and my local repros look similar. In both cases, it seems the first decoded picture (scaled smaller than the actual video playback window size) is superimposed on video. 

Thus this is possibly not a problem in the video decoder itself.
hshi@, backing up, based on to #2: avkodipelli@ ran the test on freon and non-freon parrot and saw the issue only on the freon version. -> freon regression, right ?

re:#10 yes sorry I didn't read the original bug report carefully. It was stated that

(1) Reproduces with 44.0.2403.156/7077.134.0 lumpy_freon
(2) No repro with 44.0.2403.156/7077.134.0 lumpy

So it is a freon regression, but unfortunately a very old regression. I can also reproduce this on lumpy_freon TOT.

zelidrag@ - do you know who is still actively working on Chrome OS files app (in particular the media player)?

We have this weird corruption that only happens when the media file is on Google drive yet it is played back with the Files app. The same media file itself shows no corruption when played locally or with Drive web.
Great. Thanks for checking and investigating!
fukino: Is this something you could help?

I have been trying a few older builds at the moment, and can get a repro with Chrome 43.0.2340.0 (Platform 6900.0.0 Official dev-channel lumpy_freon) that was built on March 31, 2015.

The UI glitch does not repro when I disable HW video decode acceleration.

So it now looks like this probably has never worked on Sandybridge freon.
Question: was this part of the regular test plan? As far as I can tell this problem existed since R43.
This is not a regular test scenario for chrome media player testing. We found this issue while checking some user unconfirmed bug.

I just tried Chrome 42.0.2306.0 (Official Build dev-channel lumpy-freon) 6800.0.0. This is with freon on kernel 3.4.0, and the glitch is still reproduced there.

Note that this R42 build is dated 02/17/2015.
Though its a freon regression, its too risky to take a fix in M45. Let's try to fix it in M46 first. Later we can consider the merge in M45.

Screenshot on R42 lumpy_freon for reference.

I don't think bisecting this would work because the bug exists from the beginning (we didn't have lumpy_freon on R41), so let's focus on debugging it on ToT.

yoshiki@ - please take a look, I believe you added the thumbnail code in r295893:

commit 19d31bfb5de5acba66036f5acb2a5a140d1d378d
Author: yoshiki <yoshiki@chromium.org>
Date:   Sat Sep 20 14:55:44 2014 -0700

    Files.app: Show thumbnail of non-image file even when the file cache is present

Please advise if this is the intended behavior. We are sometimes seeing a timing sensitive bug where the thumbnail keeps showing even when video already starts playing.

Hmm I did some more experiments and realized that this may not be exactly timing sensitive.

It looks like the thumbnail generation behavior is deterministic and only happens with files on Google Drive (because we have caching), and the thumbnail is not immediately available when the media file is first uploaded to Drive, therefore I don't observe the problem initially. But once the thumbnail is generated, this UI glitch is reproducible 100% on sandybridge freon.

I wonder if somehow the HW accelerated video (in the #video-container div) does not have the correct alpha set, and that allows #thumbnail to bleed through.

I also wonder if the JS can be modified so that we hide the thumbnail when video playback is active?

I'll investigate a bit more; there is probably a real issue with libva intel driver that somehow fails to fill the alpha channel for the decoded video pictures.

But in any case I'd still suggest that we modify the JS because if the video container is ARGB then we're doing a blending pass unnecessarily.

It turns out that we're using ARGB format while Intel libva driver does not appear to support setting alpha for gen5/gen6 hardware (I've tried to tweak the knobs in pp_static_parameters and pp_inline_parameters and they didn't help; unlike for gen7 we do have a grf2.alpha arg)

+posciak@ PTAL https://codereview.chromium.org/1304613003/

The following revision refers to this bug:
  https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/abab7eb0cecd4d0ca6f6a7a001eb21c8ebb0c1a8

commit abab7eb0cecd4d0ca6f6a7a001eb21c8ebb0c1a8
Author: hshi <hshi@chromium.org>
Date: Thu Aug 20 18:25:34 2015

VaapiDrmPicture: use RGBX format instead of RGBA

The format here directly influences the GL texture format. See
GLImageOzoneNativePixmap::Initialize() where FourCC(format) is called.

In general the alpha for video is undefined. On gen7 intel libva driver
actually takes care of filling alpha to 255, but this is not feasible
for gen5-6.

Note that based on my code inspection, we are really treating the enum
"gfx::BufferFormat::RGBX_8888" as a BGRX format, so I'll propose to
rename it to avoid confusion in a separate CL.

BUG=521826
TEST=verify on lumpy_freon that the bug is fixed.

Author: Haixia Shi <hshi@chromium.org>
Date: Thu Aug 20 19:34:02 2015

The following layout test is flaky failing

http/tests/serviceworker/fetch-request-redirect.html

Flakiness link:

http://test-results.appspot.com/dashboards/flakiness_dashboard.html#tests=http%2Ftests%2Fserviceworker%2Ffetch-request-redirect.html

Probable cause:

The test relies on iframe load failure detection using a 500ms timeout. This sometimes triggers when the system is slow (debug, msan, etc).

The test logic should be reworked here using something more robust for detecting expected failures, and not have a timeout which could produce false positives.
BTW, I'll work on disabling the offending cases, leave the rest of it running.
https://codereview.chromium.org/1288553009/

One fix would be to put the timeout back in conditionally i.e. only used for expected failure cases. e.g.:

iframe_test(url, {timeout: true})


But that might lead to false negatives on slow bots. Still, it'd be better than having no coverage for the failing cases.

Note, when porting the blink tests with a timeout to detect a blocked navigation in fetch-frame-resource.https.html, we ended up bumping the timeout to 5 seconds (with some other refactoring):

  https://dxr.mozilla.org/mozilla-central/source/testing/web-platform/mozilla/tests/service-workers/service-worker/fetch-frame-resource.https.html#48

This was necessary for the tests to run reliably on VMs when built with debug.

commit 7988aacc6c6afa5bbed54a5de25239e732016671
Author: horo@chromium.org <horo@chromium.org>
Date: Thu Aug 20 16:44:31 2015

VULNERABILITY DETAILS From /WebKit/Source/modules/serviceworkers/ServiceWorkerContainer.cpp: ---------------- ScriptPromise ServiceWorkerContainer::ready(ScriptState* callerState) { if (!executionContext()) return ScriptPromise(); (...) if (!m_ready) { m_ready = createReadyProperty(); if (m_provider) m_provider->getRegistrationForReady(new GetRegistrationForReadyCallback(m_ready.get())); } return m_ready->promise(callerState->world()); } ---------------- |m_ready| inherits the execution context of the serviceWorkerContainer, and that's the context associated with the navigator's frame when the container is created in NavigatorServiceWorker::serviceWorker. The navigator object can be recreated with the frame holding a cross-origin window, so the promise object created in the |m_ready->promise(callerState->world())| call may end up using a wrong creation context. VERSION Chrome 44.0.2403.155 (Stable) Chrome 45.0.2454.46 (Beta) Chrome 46.0.2486.0 (Dev) Chromium 46.0.2488.0 (Release build compiled today) REPRODUCTION CASE

I was thinking about a potential fix to this issue, and wondered if it'd be an acceptable solution to disallow the creation of navigator objects from inactive DOMWindows. In debug builds, as soon as unloadedWindow.navigator.serviceWorker is accessed, content::ServiceWorkerDispatcher::AddProviderClient fails to assert for |!ContainsKey(provider_clients_, provider_id)|, so apparently having a navigator with |m_frame| holding a different window breaks more invariants. If you're okay with the idea, I've got a patch + test for it.
kinuko@, can you take a look and assign to someone appropriate? Thanks!
Um, looks serious. Let us take a deeper look.

I think we have to check the security origin in NavigatorServiceWorker::serviceWorker().

Created a CL: https://codereview.chromium.org/1307883002

When navigating, the frame's window is reset[1] and navigator is detached. If navigator is requested to Window[2] after that, the window creates a new navigator and the navigator thinks it is registered to the frame, but it is not true. A new window is registered to the frame and hence There is a link from window -> navigator -> frame -> another window. I think that should be fixed.

1: https://code.google.com/p/chromium/codesearch#chromium/src/third_party/WebKit/Source/core/frame/LocalDOMWindow.cpp&q=DOMWindow::reset&sq=package:chromium&type=cs&l=523
2: https://code.google.com/p/chromium/codesearch#chromium/src/third_party/WebKit/Source/core/frame/LocalDOMWindow.cpp&q=DOMWindow::navigator&sq=package:chromium&type=cs&l=662

Ah yes. The root cause of this issue is that LocalDOMWindow::navigator() can creates a new Navigator even if LocalDOMWindow::reset() has been called.
I think we should check |m_hasBeenReset| in LocalDOMWindow::navigator().
I wrote https://codereview.chromium.org/1308723003/. I would love to be reviewed by experts because I don't fully understand navigator requirements.
(Thanks yhirano@!)

  http://src.chromium.org/viewvc/blink?view=rev&rev=201055

------------------------------------------------------------------
r201055 | yhirano@chromium.org | 2015-08-24T10:02:32.982204Z

Changed paths:
   A http://src.chromium.org/viewvc/blink/trunk/LayoutTests/http/tests/serviceworker/chromium/frame-removed.html?r1=201055&r2=201054&pathrev=201055
   A http://src.chromium.org/viewvc/blink/trunk/LayoutTests/http/tests/serviceworker/chromium/frame-detached-by-navigation.html?r1=201055&r2=201054&pathrev=201055
   M http://src.chromium.org/viewvc/blink/trunk/Source/core/frame/LocalDOMWindow.cpp?r1=201055&r2=201054&pathrev=201055

DOMWindow::navigator should return a navigator w/o frame when detached.

Currently DOMWindow::navigator returns a navigator associated with a frame
even when the window is detached from the frame and another window
is attached to it. That means calling frame()->document() may return
an incorrect document, for example.

This CL makes LocalDOMWindow::navigator return a navigator with
a null frame when the window is not associated to the frame.

BUG=522791

> DOMWindow::navigator should return a navigator w/o frame when detached.
> 
> Currently DOMWindow::navigator returns a navigator associated with a frame
> even when the window is detached from the frame and another window
> is attached to it. That means calling frame()->document() may return
> an incorrect document, for example.
> 
> This CL makes LocalDOMWindow::navigator return a navigator with
> a null frame when the window is not associated to the frame.
> 
> BUG=522791
